1. Minutes of the City Council - Regular Meeting - September 11, 2023 5:30 PM

RESULT:
ACCEPTED AND PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor
Siddiqui

2. Minutes of the City Council - Regular Meeting - September 18, 2023 5:30 PM
RESULT:
ACCEPTED AND PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor
Siddiqui

Oct 2, 2023

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a public health update.
CMA 2023 #245
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Toner

2. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appointment of David
Kale to the Cambridge Health Alliance Board of Trustees for a term of one year.
CMA 2023 #246
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a recommendation from
the Cambridige Election Commission regarding the assignment of thirty-two (32) police officers and
any additional officers as required to the City’s polling locations for all elections in FY24, pursuant to
G.L. c. 54, §72.
CMA 2023 #247
RESULT:
APPROVED RECOMMENDATION [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 2

Oct 2, 2023

the Community Safety Department.

Oct 2, 2023

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a Surveillance
Technology Impact Report which describes Operations & Case Management Software, requested
by the Community Safety Department.
CMA 2023 #241
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
2. Amendment to Chapter 2.78 of the Cambridge Code of Ordinance, entitled “Historical Buildings
and Landmarks.” (Ordinance #2022-11).
ORD 2022 # 11
RESULT:
ORDAINED [6-3-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Councillor
Simmons, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Toner

3. An Ordinance has been received from City Council, relative to Affordable Housing Overlay
(AHO) amendments. (Proposed Ordinance #2023-7)
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL SEPTEMBER 11, 2023
AMENDED IN COUNCIL SEPTEMBER 18, 2023
AMENDED FURTHER IN COUNCIL SEPTEMBER 18, 2023
ORD 2023 # 7
RESULT:
AMENDED [8-1-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Nolan,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Councillor Carlone


Next: 10/16/2023 5:30 PM

PAGE 4

Oct 2, 2023

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. A Zoning Petition Has been received from Allene R. Pierson, regarding Cambridge Lodging House
Zoning Change to strengthen Cambridge residential housing efforts, mitigate the disruptive impacts
of short-term platform-based market rate rentals.
APP 2023 #51
RESULT:
REFERRED TO COMMITTEE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui
THE ORDINANCE

Oct 2, 2023

PAGE 12

Oct 2, 2023

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested to work with CDD and the Law Department to review the
proposed amendment to BEUDO regarding new buildings, and to propose adjustments, especially
with regards to the building permit vs certificate of occupancy question.
POR 2023 #166
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. That the City Manager is requested to direct CDD to meet with the Universities, large labs, large
property developers and anyone with technical expertise regarding the proposed BEUDO amendment
to get their input.
POR 2023 #167
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Cambridge Police Department to place a
Crossing Guard on the corner of Putnam Avenue and Western Avenue for one hour before the start of
the CRLS school day and one hour after dismissal.
POR 2023 #168
Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

4. That the City Manager is requested to work with all relevant City departments to install a needle lock
box, an emergency call box, and a Narcan box in the plaza outside the Central Square Library.
POR 2023 #169
Councillor McGovern, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 13

Oct 2, 2023

5. That the City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate City staff to determine the feasibility of
erecting a covered bus shelter in the immediate vicinity of 15 Lambert Street.
POR 2023 #170
Councillor Simmons, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

6. That the City Manager is requested to work with all relevant departments to change the hours of off
leash usage at Joan Lorentz Park to 6:00 to 8:00 am to allow usage prior to typical work hours.
POR 2023 #171
Councillor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Toner
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

7. Appointment of Lauren Reznick to the Cambridge Redevelopment Authority for a five-year term.
POR 2023 #172
Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

8. Housing contributions from the City's Major Institutions.
POR 2023 #173
Councillor Carlone, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Nolan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 14

Oct 2, 2023

9. That the City Council schedule a roundtable on Monday, October 23, 2023, from 3:00 p.m. - 5 p.m. to
receive an update from the City Manager, relevant departments, and community partners on Central
Square.
POR 2023 #174
Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

10. That the City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate City staff to affix the Indigenous
Peoples’ Day Banner above JFK Street and Mount Auburn Street beginning on October 4, 2023.
POR 2023 #175
Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

11. National Clean Investment Fund Grant Support Letter.
POR 2023 #176
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

12. That the City Manager is requested to work with the License Commission and other relevant
departments to prepare recommendations on regulations that would ban or limit the sale of nips in
Cambridge. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TONER IN COUNCIL
OCTOBER 2, 2023
POR 2023 #177
Councillor Nolan, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TONER
Next: 10/16/2023 5:30 PM

PAGE 15

Oct 2, 2023

13. That the City Manager is requested to reaffirm the city’s commitment to renovating the schoolhouse
at 105 Windsor Street as a top priority following the completion of the Central Square lots study.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR SIMMONS IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 2,
2023
